# LiveGrade - LSAC GPA Calculator & Converter

> An accurate, web-based tool designed to help law school applicants estimate their CAS GPA using official LSAC 4.0/4.33 grade conversion methodology.

This site provides a specialized calculator that mirrors the Law School Admission Council (LSAC) Credential Assembly Service (CAS) process, allowing students to convert letter grades and credit hours into a standardized GPA.

## Core Tool
- [LSAC GPA Calculator](https://livegrade.site/): The primary tool to add subjects, credit hours, and letter grades to calculate an estimated CAS GPA.

## Key Information
- [How LSAC Calculates GPA](https://livegrade.site/#how-it-works): Detailed explanation of transcript review, grade standardization, and the weighted GPA formula used by LSAC.
- [Official LSAC Grade Conversion Table](https://livegrade.site/#lsac-gpa-scale): A reference table showing the numerical values assigned to letter grades (e.g., A+ = 4.33, A = 4.0).
- [LSAC vs. University GPA](https://livegrade.site/#lsac-vs-university): Clarification on why official CAS GPAs often differ from institutional GPAs.

## Resources & FAQ
- [GPA Targets for Law Schools](https://livegrade.site/#faqs): Benchmarks for T14 schools and regional programs.
- [Frequently Asked Questions](https://livegrade.site/#faqs): Answers regarding retaken courses, graduate school grades, and community college credits in the LSAC system.
- [About the Developer](https://livegrade.site/#about): Background on the project and its commitment to accurate academic tools.

## Optional
- [International Student Guidance](https://livegrade.site/#international): Information on how international transcripts are processed.
- [Privacy Policy](https://livegrade.site/): No user data is stored; all calculations are performed locally in the browser.
